availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William B. Parker (Maysville (Mason County), Ky, hotelkeeper & jailer)

body.p: Maysville, Kentucky, hotelkeeper and jailer. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Parker. Father of William C. Parker, James P. Parker, Lucy Jane Parker Ball, Mason B. Parker, W. W. Seth Parker, and Orlando B. Parker. Hotelkeeper in Maysville, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned seven enslaved persons in Maysville in 1850. Jailer in Maysville in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville District 1, p. 38A-B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville District 1, p. 689.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville Ward 2, p. 317.
Find A Grave, "William B. ‘Red Buck’ Parker (1789-1868)," Memorial #187489855, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/187489855/william-b.-parker (accessed July 26, 2021).
